application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description:
T1 - ash tree (14m) - reduce crown to previous pruning points, approximately 3m reduction and lift crown by removing horizontal branches on N and NE sides of crown.

T2 - lime tree (11m) - reduce crown to previous pruning points, approximately 2m reduction.

T3 -  lime tree (13m) - reduce crown to previous pruning points, approximately 2m reduction.

T4 - lime tree (11m) - reduce crown to previous pruning points, approximately 2m reduction.

T5 - birch tree (8m) - reduce branches away from house by approximately 2m.

T6 - birch tree (12m) - reduce height by approximately 3m and reduce branches away from house by approximately 2m.

T7 - birch tree (8m) - reduce branches away from house by approximately 1.5m.

T9 - ash tree (14m) - reduce crown to previous pruning points, approximately 3m reduction, remove deadwood and lift crown by removing horizontal branches on W and S sides of crown ( this includes the removal of horizontal branches overhanging the neighbours property).
decision_conditions:
TREE WORKS (COMPLIANCE):  All tree work shall be carried out in accordance with British Standard BS3998 - Recommendations for Tree Work.  In addition: 
a)   No fires shall be lit within [10] metres of the nearest point of the canopy of any retained tree.  No equipment, machinery or structure shall be attached to or supported by a retained tree.
b)   No mixing of cement or use of other contaminating materials or substances shall take place within, or close enough to, a root protection area that seepage or displacement could cause them to enter a root protection area. 
c)   No alterations or variations to the approved works or tree protection schemes shall be made without prior written consent of the local planning authority.

REASON:  In the interest of the protection of trees and to safeguard visual amenities.
